# MTLVertexAttribute

**Class**

An instance that represents an attribute of a vertex function.

## Declaration

```swift
class MTLVertexAttribute
```

## Overview

An [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLVertexAttribute] instance represents an attribute for per-vertex input in a vertex function. You use vertex attribute instances to inspect the inputs of a vertex function by examining the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLFunction/vertexAttributes] property of the corresponding [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLFunction] instance.

## Describing the attribute

- **name**: The name of the attribute.
- **attributeIndex**: The index of the attribute, as declared in Metal shader source code.
- **attributeType**: The data type for the attribute, as declared in Metal shader source code.
- **isActive**: A Boolean value that indicates whether this vertex attribute is active.
- **isPatchControlPointData**: A Boolean value that indicates whether this vertex attribute represents control point data.
- **isPatchData**: A Boolean value that indicates whether this vertex attribute represents patch data.

## Function arguments

- **MTLAttribute**: An object that describes an attribute defined in the stage-in argument for a shader.
- **MTLArgument**: Information about an argument of a graphics or compute function.
- **MTLAutoreleasedArgument**: A convenience type alias for an autoreleased argument instance.
- **MTLArgumentType**: The resource type for an argument of a function.
- **MTLArgumentAccess**: Function access restrictions to argument data in the shading language code.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
